introduction: This video discusses the concept of consistent hashing and its use in distributed systems. It explains how consistent hashing distributes data evenly across servers and allows for efficient data partitioning, content delivery, and load balancing. The video covers the core insights of consistent hashing, including the use of a uniformly distributed hash function, the distribution of objects on the hash ring, and the use of virtual nodes to balance the distribution of objects. The video also explores real-world applications of consistent hashing in popular NoSQL databases, content delivery networks, and load balancers.
